cairns.david.engine

Class TileMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • cairns.david.engine.TileMap

  • public class TileMap
extends java.lang.Object
    TileMap enables you to load a character based tile map from a text file. An example of the format for such a text file is given below: 10 5 32 32 // The first line should contain the width and height of the // map and the width and height of each tile. A list of character to // tile mappings is then provided where each character is preceded by a // # character. The dot character always defaults to a blank space // Note that the referenced files should be in the same directory as the // tile map. #b=orangeblock.png #c=greencircle.png #g=glasses.png // The actual tile map is preceded by the #map line #map bbbbbbbbbb b........b b..g.....b bccccccccb bbbbbbbbbb }
    Author:
    David Cairns

      • loadMap

        public boolean loadMap(java.lang.String folder,
                       java.lang.String mapfile)
        Loads a 'mapfile' that is contained in the given 'folder'. It is expected that the images associated with the map will also be in 'folder'.
        Parameters:
        folder - The folder the tile map and images are located in
        mapfile - The name of the map file in the map folder
        Returns:
        true if the map loaded successfully, false otherwise

      • getTileImage

        public java.awt.Image getTileImage(int x,
                                   int y)
        Get the Image object associated with the tile at position 'x','y'
        Parameters:
        x - The x tile coordinate (in tiles, not pixels)
        y - The y tile coordinate (in tiles, not pixels)
        Returns:
        The Image object associated with the tile at position 'x,y', null if blank or not found

        Parameters:

        x - The x tile coordinate (in tiles, not pixels)
        y - The y tile coordinate (in tiles, not pixels)
        Returns:
